intro: Tithymalus declinatus, commonly known as the slender tithymalus, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. It has finely divided, fern-like leaves that help it to efficiently capture sunlight. Tithymalus declinatus is often found in temperate regions and is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological benefits.
